result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jay A. Bean

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jay A. Bean in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF90, 17CF30 ,17CF39, 17CF41 & 17CF62 tracking together:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement Ct. 1 in 17CF39 and Counts 1 & 2 in 17CF41.  All other cases to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Johnson agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 17CF39 and Counts 1 & 2 in 17CF41.  All other cases to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.  Atty Hendee waives the request for a PSI.
Atty Johnson makes sentencing arguments.  Atty Johnson waives the request for a PSI.

BY THE COURT:  17CF39:  Impose and Stay; 12 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber:
May transfer to Columbia County
2 years Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $268.00
DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent

17CF41:  Ct. 1:  Court orders 145 days in the Marquette County Jail
Credit = 118 days
Time Served
Court Costs = $268.00
DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge

Ct. 2:  Court Costs = $268.00
DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge

15CF90, 17CF30 & 17CF62 to be dismissed and read-in.
No PSI ordered
Cash bonds from all cases to be applied; if any balance, this is to be applied to Attorney fees for Atty Johnson.
Attorney fees to be paid by payment plan.
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on December 1, 2017

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
for Leave to File Additional Motions
Jay Bean is responsible for re-payment to Marquette County
to Court from Jay Bean regarding Counsel

from Atty Hendee to reset JT; officer not available.  Ok'd by Judge.

Final pre-trial on December 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on January 12, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jay A. Bean in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant now appears in court and will withdraw his request for a warrant.
BY THE COURT:  Warrant quashed; cash bond will be reinstated.

Atty Peebles asks for a return date and a trial date be set.

BY THE COURT:  Court will set for a Jury Trial.
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for January 12, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney James D. Peebles in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Peebles states that he did send his client a reminder message and is not sure why he is not here today.  Atty Peebles states that the defendant has other cases in Columbia County.
  Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.  Cash bond will be forfieted.
Return date on September 22, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Final pre-trial on September 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on October 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jay A. Bean in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Peebles states that the parties are not at resolution and asks for a trial be set.

BY THE COURT:  Set for trial.
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for October 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Return date at 04-07-2016 02:30 pm

Defendant Jay A. Bean in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the parties are prepared to proceed today with the Prelim.  Atty Peebles agrees.  
Michael Ciezadlo called and sworn; examined by Atty Hendee.
Cross-examined by Atty Peebles.
Witness excused.

Atty Hendee files a certified copy of the bond  from case 13CF85.
Atty Peebles has no objection
BY THE COURT:  Court will take judicial notice of the certified bond.

Atty Hendee asks the court to find probable cause and make arguments.
Atty Peebles makes arguments.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

  Atty Hendee files the information with the court.    Atty Peebles states that the Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.  Atty Peebles enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 03-02-2016 10:00 am

amended as to conditions

*Maintain absolute sobriety - zero tolerance.  *No contact with Terri Bean.  *1-6-16:  Amended to allow defendant to go with 1 time with law enforcement to pick up the vehicle, tool, etc. once vicitm is notified by Atty Peebles.

Defendant Jay A. Bean in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Peebles states his motion.  Requests modification of certain conditions of the bond.  Requests access to his shop on the property.  Atty Hendee responds and objects to modification.  Atty Peebles responds.  
BY THE COURT:  Court will allow defendant to go with 1 time with law enforcement to pick up the vehicle, tool, etc. once vicitm is notified by Atty Peebles.  Court will not allow him to go to the shop and do the work there.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived; set for Prelim.
bond continued.

STATEMENT OF COMPLIANCE
Initial appearance at 12-28-2015 02:30 pm
Initial appearance at 12-28-2015 02:30 pm
*Maintain absolute sobriety - zero tolerance.  *No contact with Terri Bean.

Judge Bult appears by phone.
Defendant Jay A. Bean by video, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states charges.  BY THE COURT:  For Riverside-McLaughlin purposes, Court finds probable cause to support the charges.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.
Atty Hendee requests $250 cash bond with conditions.  Defendant makes statement and requests signature bond.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets $250 cash bond with conditions.
Defendant makes statement and requests court appointed attorney.  Court questions defendant.
BY THE COURT:  Court will appoint Atty James Peebles on this case.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
